name: II. Data Description and Preparation
content:
Data Description

The project utilizes four datasets:

1.Stores dataset

  • Variables: Store ID, Type (categorical), Size (numerical).
  • Provides store-level characteristics.

2.Features dataset

  • Variables: Date, Temperature, Fuel Price, MarkDowns (1–5), CPI, Unemployment, IsHoliday.
  • Covers economic and environmental factors over time.

3.Train dataset

  • Variables: Store, Dept, Date, Weekly_Sales (numerical target), IsHoliday (boolean).
  • Weekly granularity with sales outcomes for model training.

4.Test dataset

  • Variables: Store, Dept, Date, IsHoliday.
  • Holds the future periods for which forecasts need to be generated.

Granularity: Store–Department–Week level.

Time period: February 2010 to November 2012 (approx.).

Data types:

  • Categorical: Store ID, Dept ID, Type, IsHoliday.
  • Numerical: Weekly_Sales, Size, Temperature, Fuel Price, MarkDowns, CPI, Unemployment.
  • Date/Temporal: Date.

Data Preparation

Key preparation steps include:

  • Handling missing values: Imputation strategies for missing MarkDown variables and other gaps.
  • Outlier detection: Identifying anomalies in sales (holiday spikes) or incorrect entries.
  • Feature engineering:
  • Time-based features (month, year, week number).
  • Holiday proximity indicators.
  • Lagged sales and rolling averages for trend capture.
  • Transformation:
  • Log transformation for skewed variables like sales.
  • Normalization/scaling of continuous features such as fuel price, CPI, and unemployment.
  • Encoding: Convert categorical variables (e.g., Store Type, IsHoliday) into machine-readable form.
